Package com.example.fairdraw.Models

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.fairdraw.Models.Event
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Event extends Object implements Serializable
Represents an event created in the application. An Event contains metadata such as title, description, capacity, registration windows and lists that manage the lottery/waiting list workflow (waitingList, invitedList, enrolledList, cancelledList).

The class provides utility methods to draw lottery winners, replace winners when they decline, and accept or cancel winners.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event(String title, String description, Integer capacity, Date regPeriod, Date time, String location, String organizer, Float price, String posterPath, String qrSlug)
      Creates a new Event with the required fields. A UUID will be generated for the event.
      Parameters:
      title - human-readable title of the event
      description - brief description of the event
      capacity - maximum number of attendees allowed
      regPeriod - generic registration period date (legacy field)
      time - scheduled time of the event
      location - textual location of the event
      organizer - organizer id or name
      price - ticket price (nullable for free events)
      posterPath - path or url to the event poster image
      qrSlug - identifier used for QR check-ins or short-links

    • Event

      public Event(String title, String description, Integer capacity, Integer waitingListLimit, Date regPeriod, Date openRegDate, Date closeRegDate, Date time, Date startDate, Date endDate, String location, String organizer, Float price, Boolean geolocation, String posterPath, String qrSlug)
      Extended constructor supporting optional scheduling, registration windows and geolocation.
      Parameters:
      title - title of the event
      description - description of the event
      capacity - maximum attendees
      waitingListLimit - maximum waiting list size (nullable)
      regPeriod - generic registration period date
      openRegDate - registration open date
      closeRegDate - registration close date
      time - scheduled time
      startDate - event start date
      endDate - event end date
      location - event location string
      organizer - event organizer id or name
      price - ticket price
      geolocation - whether geolocation is required
      posterPath - poster image path or url
      qrSlug - QR slug for check-in

    • Event

      public Event()
      No-argument constructor required for Firestore deserialization.

    • isEnrolled

      public boolean isEnrolled(String deviceId)
      Returns true if the given deviceId is already enrolled (registered) for the event.

    • isInvited

      public boolean isInvited(String deviceId)
      Returns true if the given deviceId has been invited (won the lottery) for the event.

    • isOnWaitingList

      public boolean isOnWaitingList(String deviceId)
      Returns true if the given deviceId is already on the waiting list.

    • canJoinWaitingList

      public boolean canJoinWaitingList(String deviceId)
      Returns whether the provided deviceId is allowed to join the lottery waiting list. False if the user is already enrolled, already invited, already on the waiting list, the waiting list limit has been reached (when configured), or the provided id is null.

    • getJoinWaitlistButtonText

      @StringRes public int getJoinWaitlistButtonText(String deviceId)
      Returns the appropriate string resource id to display on the Join Lottery Waitlist button for the given deviceId. Resource ids map to localized UI strings.

    • isJoinWaitlistButtonEnabled

      public boolean isJoinWaitlistButtonEnabled(String deviceId)
      Convenience method for UI: whether the Join Lottery Waitlist button should be enabled for the provided deviceId.

    • drawLotteryWinners

      public List<String> drawLotteryWinners()
      Selects new lottery winners from the waiting list to fill the event up to its capacity. Existing invitees are preserved.
      Returns:
      A list of the new winners' device ids.

    • replaceLotteryWinner

      public String replaceLotteryWinner(String oldWinner)
      Replaces an existing winner with a new one from the waiting list cause the oldWinner rejected their invitation. Removes the oldWinner from the invited list and adds them to the cancelled list.
      Parameters:
      oldWinner - The winner to be replaced.
      Returns:
      The new winner's deviceId, or null if no replacement is possible.

    • cancelLotteryWinner

      public void cancelLotteryWinner(String deviceId)
      Cancels an invited winner by moving them from the invited list to the cancelled list. If the provided deviceId is not in the invited list this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - device id of the invited user to cancel

    • acceptLotteryWinner

      public void acceptLotteryWinner(String deviceId)
      Accepts an invited winner by moving them from the invited list to the enrolled list. If the provided deviceId is not in the invited list this method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - device id of the invited user to accept
